issue.title: FileUtilTest sometimes takes a very long time to run
issue.body:
It appears that `lsof` is blocking/hanging. See https://teamcity.chronicle.software/buildConfiguration/Chronicle_BuildAll_OpenHFTJava11Bumped/743865?buildTab=tests&status=all&orderBy=duration&order=desc

Suggest we consolidate FileUtil & MappedFileUtil (but use MappedFileUtil's approach of using `/proc/self/maps` to work around `lsof` hanging).

FileUtil was introduced in #636, has documentation and is part of the public API, but is not used anywhere in our other libraries

issue.title: ConnectionListener#onDisconnected is called twice for every disconnect
issue.body:
(when using the UberHandler at least)

It's called here

https://github.com/OpenHFT/Chronicle-Network/blob/5d53d322e4b1713c6e8ce24326038f4e382a0b53/src/main/java/net/openhft/chronicle/network/cluster/handlers/UberHandler.java#L157

and here

https://github.com/OpenHFT/Chronicle-Network/blob/5d53d322e4b1713c6e8ce24326038f4e382a0b53/src/main/java/net/openhft/chronicle/network/cluster/handlers/HeartbeatHandler.java#L227-L228

issue.title: IOException thrown when a read from a FastJ8SocketChannel fails due to the underying channel being closed
issue.body: It should throw `ClosedChannelException` like the other implementations do (this is handled in lots of places)

issue.title: UberHandler heartbeat timeout being reset on send OR receive
issue.body:
The timeout in the UberHandler's HeartbeatHandler is being reset on every send OR receive. So it effectively never triggers. As long as you're sending heartbeats, it won't time-out, even if it's not receiving any from the other side:

https://github.com/OpenHFT/Chronicle-Network/blob/7d76645288747fb66a8a8ff963e63c1451e17414/src/main/java/net/openhft/chronicle/network/cluster/handlers/UberHandler.java#L289-L293

issue.title: Fix tests on macOS M1.
issue.body:
Upgrade `jnr-ffi` to allow running on newer macOS versions (which require for signed binaries).
Disable tests for macOS for unsupported system calls.

issue.title: FileUtilTest sometimes takes a very long time to run
issue.body:
It appears that `lsof` is blocking/hanging. See https://teamcity.chronicle.software/buildConfiguration/Chronicle_BuildAll_OpenHFTJava11Bumped/743865?buildTab=tests&status=all&orderBy=duration&order=desc

Suggest we consolidate FileUtil & MappedFileUtil (but use MappedFileUtil's approach of using `/proc/self/maps` to work around `lsof` hanging).

FileUtil was introduced in #636, has documentation and is part of the public API, but is not used anywhere in our other libraries

commits.message: Traverse /proc/[pid]/fd/* to discover open files instead of using lsof, Fixes #1234

issue.title: ConnectionListener#onDisconnected is called twice for every disconnect
issue.body:
(when using the UberHandler at least)

It's called here

https://github.com/OpenHFT/Chronicle-Network/blob/5d53d322e4b1713c6e8ce24326038f4e382a0b53/src/main/java/net/openhft/chronicle/network/cluster/handlers/UberHandler.java#L157

and here

https://github.com/OpenHFT/Chronicle-Network/blob/5d53d322e4b1713c6e8ce24326038f4e382a0b53/src/main/java/net/openhft/chronicle/network/cluster/handlers/HeartbeatHandler.java#L227-L228

issue.title: IOException thrown when a read from a FastJ8SocketChannel fails due to the underying channel being closed
issue.body: It should throw `ClosedChannelException` like the other implementations do (this is handled in lots of places)

issue.title: UberHandler heartbeat timeout being reset on send OR receive
issue.body:
The timeout in the UberHandler's HeartbeatHandler is being reset on every send OR receive. So it effectively never triggers. As long as you're sending heartbeats, it won't time-out, even if it's not receiving any from the other side:

https://github.com/OpenHFT/Chronicle-Network/blob/7d76645288747fb66a8a8ff963e63c1451e17414/src/main/java/net/openhft/chronicle/network/cluster/handlers/UberHandler.java#L289-L293

issue.title: Fix tests on macOS M1.
issue.body:
Upgrade `jnr-ffi` to allow running on newer macOS versions (which require for signed binaries).
Disable tests for macOS for unsupported system calls.
